msContents.summary: This is a Northeastern Italian manuscript from the later part of the third quarter of the fifteenth century. It contains Onasander's Libro de optimo imperatore, translated into the Latin by Nicolaus Sagundinus.

msItem.title: Onosander, Libro de optimo imperatore, Preface
msItem.incipit: [S]uperiore tempore serenissime Rex cum apud maiestatem tuam. Inclini senati veneti iussu annum ferme in urbe Neapoli peregissem satis intelligere potui multisque rationibus coniecturam facile feci.
msItem.explicit: Eque enim et res abste geste autoritate atque amplitudine regia illustrantur et dignitas ac maiestas ipsa rerum gestarum celebritate et gloria decoratur. Sed iam onosandrum ipsum audiamus.

msItem.title: Onosander, Libro de optimo imperatore
msItem.explicit: Verum etiam perpetuande propagandeue sue glorie citra periculum sapiens imperator atque custos et moderator diligentissimus.

support.watermark: Unidentified watermark, barely visible, fols. 6 and 23

supportDesc.extent: i+30+i; 191 x 137 mm bound to 198 x 147 mm
supportDesc.foliation: Modern foliation in pencil, upper right recto

p.catchwords: Vertical catchwords along the bounding line

layoutDesc.layout: Single column of thirty-one lines; Horizontal rules in brown ink; full-length single vertical bounding lines ruled in lead or brown crayon; single large pricking in the outer margin; written area: 149 x 105 mm

decoDesc.decoNote: Two blank spaces for four-line initials; guide letters for initials throughout
Inside front coverRound heraldic bookplate for Reverend Walter Sneyd: "Guelteri Sneyd ex-libris."
Inside front coverBookseller's notes in pencil
[Flyleaf 1 recto]Bookplate for the Wigan Free Library
[Flyleaf 1 verso]Note in ink in middle of page: "42411."
1rOval stamp in blind for the Wigan Free Library
28rOval stamp in blind for the Wigan Free Library
[Flyleaf 1 verso]Bookseller's note in pencil in upper left corner: "TM661"

binding.p: Nineteenth- or early twentieth-century half leather and marbled paper binding, spine with gilt title: "ONOSANDER LATINE M.S. SAEC. XV"

history.provenance: Reverend Walter Sneyd of Keele Hall Staffordshire (1809-1888), who acquired the surplus of Matteo Luigi Canonici's library in 1835. His round heraldic bookplate pasted inside front cover: "Guelteri Sneyd ex-libris." Sold at Sotheby's 16 December 1903, lot. 565. Belonged to Wigan Free Library, their oval stamp in blind on fols. 1 and 28; and their large printed bookplate front flyleaf fol. i; front cover on paper, "Case 13" and front flyleaf fol. iv, "E.P.B. case 13"; bought from George Winter, 1904, his name on a blue paper slip loosely inserted. Described as MS 42411 while at the Wigan Library
